SBC - subband codec, specified by the Bluetooth Special Interest Group. SBC is a default codec for A2DP and it's always supported by any bluetooth audio device such as headphones, speakers, etc. and smartphones that use A2DP. 

SBC with its 345 kbps bitrate for stereo stream can deliver audio with up to 48 kHz sampling frequency and usually 16 bits per sample. SBC is of course a lossy codec as it is based on MPEG-1 Audio Layer II standard and it uses adaptive bit allocation algorithm in combination with adaptive block PCM quantizer. SBC's practical quality can be compared with .mp3 format. 

Subband coding involves breaking a signal into a 4 or 8 frequency bands that are being processed independently by the encoder. This process brings significant compression potential in many compression techniques. During SBC coding psychoacoustic model is being used as some parts of the sound, that human ear is not suppose to hear clearly,are being filtered out.
